content: the IBM z16. IBM z16 servers support dynamic provisioning features to give clients exceptional flexibility and control over system capacity and costs. This chapter includes the following topics:  8.1, “Introduction” on page 328  8.2, “Permanent and Temporary Upgrades” on page 328  8.3, “Concurrent upgrades” on page 334  8.4, “Miscellaneous equipment specification upgrades” on page 341  8.5, “Permanent upgrade by using the CIU facility” on page 347  8.6, “On/Off Capacity on Demand” on page 352  8.7, “z/OS Capacity Provisioning” on page 359  8.8, “System Recovery Boost Upgrade” on page 364  8.9, “Capacity for Planned Event” on page 365  8.10, “Capacity Backup” on page 365  8.11, “Flexible Capacity Cyber Resiliency” on page 370  8.12, “Planning for nondisruptive upgrades” on page 372  8.13, “Summary of Capacity on-Demand offerings” on page 378 8 328 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide 8.1 Introduction A key resource for managing client IBM Z servers is the IBM Resource Link
